009package imagingbook.common.image.access;
010
011import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
012import imagingbook.common.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
013
014/** 
015 * Accessor for vector-valued images with arbitrary depth 
016 * (number of components).
017 *
018 */
019public abstract class VectorAccessor extends ImageAccessor {
020        
021        final int depth;
022        final ScalarAccessor[] componentAccessors;
023
024        VectorAccessor(ImageProcessor ip, int depth, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
025                super(ip, obs, ipm);
026                this.depth = depth;
027                this.componentAccessors = new ScalarAccessor[this.depth];
028                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
029                        componentAccessors[k] = makeComponentAccessor(k);
030                }
031        }
032        
033        /**
034         * To be implemented by all real sublasses of {@link ScalarAccessor}, 
035         * who know how to create an accessor object to their k-th component.
036         * See {@link RgbAccessor#makeComponentAccessor(int)} for an example.
037         * 
038         * @param k the component index
039         * @return the image accessor for the specified component
040         */
041        abstract ScalarAccessor makeComponentAccessor(int k);
042        
043        @Override
044        public int getDepth() {
045                return this.depth;
046        }
047        
048        @Override
049        public ScalarAccessor getComponentAccessor(int k) {
050                checkComponentIndex(k);
051                return componentAccessors[k];
052        }
053        
054        @Override
055        public float getVal(int u, int v, int k) {
056                checkComponentIndex(k);
057                return componentAccessors[k].getVal(u, v);
058        }
059        
060        @Override
061        public float getVal(double x, double y, int k) {
062                checkComponentIndex(k);
063                return componentAccessors[k].getVal(x, y);
064        }
065        
066        @Override
067        public void setVal(int u, int v, int k, float val) {
068                checkComponentIndex(k);
069                componentAccessors[k].setVal(u, v, val);
070        }
071        
072        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
073        
074//      @Override
075//      public void setDefaultValue(float val) {
076//              for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
077//                      componentAccessors[k].setDefaultValue(val);
078//              }
079//      }
080        
081//      @Override
082//      public void setDefaultValue(float[] vals) {
083//              if (vals.length != depth) {
084//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("default values must be of length " + depth);
085//              }
086//              for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
087//                      componentAccessors[k].setDefaultValue(vals[k]);
088//              }
089//      }
090        
091        @Override
092        void checkComponentIndex(int k) {
093                if (k < 0 || k >= depth) {
094                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("invalid component index " + k);
095                }
096        }
097
098}
